title: Motorola's 2023 Vision: Revolutionizing Classrooms with Advanced Educational Technology
text:
“`html
Motorola Unveils Smartphone Guide for Students as Classes resume
With the academic year approaching, Motorola has launched a comprehensive guide showcasing smartphone options tailored for students across all levels of education.The guide highlights devices designed to meet diverse academic and personal needs,offered at competitive prices.Featured smartphones include the Motorola Edge 50 , Motorola Edge 50 Fusion , Moto G55 5G , and Moto G35 5G , aiming to equip students with the technology necessary for success in their studies. these devices promise a blend of performance, durability, and affordability, catering to the unique demands of student life.
Motorola Edge 50: Utility Meets Self-Expression The Motorola Edge 50 combines aesthetics with robust durability, making it a compelling choice for students. It is touted as the thinnest smartphone globally with MIL-STD-810H military certification and an IP68 rating. This certification ensures the device can withstand high humidity, extreme temperatures, and immersion in up to 1.5 meters of water. This makes it ideal for students who lead active lives and require a phone that can keep up with their demanding schedules and environments.
The camera capabilities of the Motorola Edge 50 are also noteworthy. It features a 50-megapixel main camera with optical image stabilization, allowing users to capture clear images even in motion. For students interested in photography, the 10MP Telephoto lens offers a 3X optical zoom and a 30x Super zoom for capturing distant details. Additionally, a 13 MP hybrid lens combines ultra-wide-angle functionality, perfect for landscapes or group photos.
Battery life is a crucial consideration for students, and the Motorola Edge 50 addresses this with a 5000mAh battery, designed to last throughout the day. When a recharge is needed, the 68W TurboPower charger provides a full day’s power in just 15 minutes. The device also supports 15W wireless charging for added convenience.
Motorola Edge 50 Fusion: Premium Features for Demanding Students The Motorola Edge 50 Fusion is designed for students who prioritize style and elegance. It is available in several colors, including bluish green, fragco pink in vegan suede, and Arctic blue, offering a touch of exclusivity.This phone aims to make a statement while providing the necessary functionality for academic pursuits.
The Edge 50 Fusion features a 50 MP main camera with a Lytia Lyt-700c sensor, ensuring high-speed capture with minimal noise in low-light conditions.Optical image stabilization (OIS) prevents images and videos from blurring, even in challenging conditions.The device also includes a 13 MP ultra-wide-angle camera and macro functionality for capturing extreme close-ups.
The device boasts a remarkable 6.7-inch Full HD+ edge screen, bringing cinematic entertainment to life with millions of tones. A 120 Hz refresh rate ensures fluid movements and transitions, making it ideal for students who rely on audiovisual materials for studying. Complementing the screen quality, the audio system is compatible with Dolby atmos, providing a surround sound experience.
the Motorola Edge 50 Fusion offers premium features and an elegant design. Moto G55 5G: Optimal Performance for Academic Activities The Moto G55 5G is designed to provide young people with optimal performance for all academic activities. Its long-lasting battery is optimized to run multiple applications concurrently without sacrificing productivity. This makes it a reliable tool for students juggling various tasks, from research to online classes.
The device features a large 6.5-inch LCD FHD+ screen, delivering luminous colors and clear visuals for games, video conferences, online classes, and streaming content. A 120Hz refresh rate ensures a fluid experience,while a brightness level of 1000 nits and boosted color display improve contrast and colors,even in sunny conditions. The Moto G55 5G also comes equipped with stereo speakers and Dolby Atmos support for an immersive sound experience.
The camera system includes a 50MP camera with quad pixel technology, optical stabilization, and self-effect technology. This allows students to capture high-quality images in various settings, from face-to-face classes to concerts and sporting events.
The Moto G55 5G offers optimal performance and a long-lasting battery. Moto G35 5G: Study and Entertainment at Hand The Moto G35 5G is designed for students who want to combine study with uninterrupted entertainment. It offers ultra-fast speeds, an amazing screen, and captivating audio. Its attractive design, long-lasting battery, and excellent camera system allow students to take photos, navigate online tasks, use social networks, and watch movies for extended periods.
For students who have days full of video calls or late-night study sessions, the Moto G35 5G features a 5000mAh battery to ensure they stay connected. All of these devices also support the use of two lines, as they come with eSIM+PSIM capabilities.
Prices and Availability The Motorola Edge 50 is available for $449,990. The Motorola Edge 50 fusion is priced at $299,990. The Moto G55 5G costs $209,990,and the Moto G35 5G is available for $149,990.
Other models, such as the Moto G04S and Moto G85, are available at special prices of $84,990 and $259,990, respectively.
These devices can be found at Motorola stores and online at motorola.cl , with options for up to 12 interest-free installments.
Motorola continues to innovate and provide students with reliable and feature-rich smartphone options to support their academic journeys.

WTN: The Motorola guide features the Edge 50, Edge 50 Fusion, Moto G55 5G, and Moto G35 5G. Can you compare and contrast these models, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses for students?
Dr. Sharma: Each Motorola phone in this series caters to different needs and budgets. The Edge 50 excels in durability with its military-grade certification and water resistance, making it ideal for students with active lifestyles. Its camera system is also notable. The Moto G55 5G offers a compelling balance of performance, battery life, and affordability, providing solid functionality without breaking the bank. the Moto G35 5G is the most budget-kind option, making it a viable choice for students on a tighter budget who still need reliable connectivity and a decent user experiance. The key is aligning specific model features with the student’s individual needs and priorities.
WTN: Beyond the core specifications, what other features should students consider, such as software, security, and after-sales service?
Dr. Sharma: Excellent question! The student needs to think about the whole ecosystem. Software updates are vital, ensuring the device continues to recieve necessary security patches and performance improvements over its lifespan. Robust security features —fingerprint sensors, facial recognition, or strong password protection—are also essential to safeguarding sensitive academic data and personal information. Additionally, reliable customer support and warranty coverage are crucial in case of unexpected repairs or technical issues.Choosing a manufacturer with a strong reputation for after-sales service will ultimately provide some peace of mind.
WTN: What advice would you offer students to ensure they make an informed decision when purchasing a smartphone for academic use?
Dr. Sharma: Here’s a checklist:
Define your budget: Set a realistic budget and stick to it.
Prioritize essential features: Battery life,display quality,and reliable connectivity should top your list.
Read reviews: Check online reviews from other students to get first-hand perspectives on the long-term performance and usability of each model.
Consider long-term value: Look beyond the initial price; account for potential repair costs and the projected lifespan before taking the plunge.
* Don’t overspend: Some features might be desirable, but not critical. Prioritize essential functionality over less substantial aspects of the device.
WTN: what’s your overall assessment of Motorola’s approach to catering to the student market with this thorough guide?
Dr. Sharma: Motorola’s guide offers a valuable resource for students by clearly outlining the key features and price points of their various devices. By presenting a range of options catering to diverse needs and budgets, the company demonstrates a clear understanding of the student market. This approach should enable students to make a more informed decision, ensuring they select a smartphone that effectively supports their academic journey.
The right technology empowers students to excel. This interview highlighted the importance of selecting a smartphone that’s not just powerful, but also fits budget and supports their study needs. What are your thoughts? Share your experiences in the comments below!

title: Sisters behind 'A Life of Literature' TikTok step into the publishing business with Bindery
text:
Back in spring 2021, Eyewitness News
shared the story of two sisters in Britain who were using TikTok to encourage other teens to read.
Mireille and Elodie Lee's
"A Life of Literature" account has grown dramatically since then, and now they're stepping into the publishing business.
The Lee sisters' move to become publishers is all more remarkable when you consider Mireille is just 18 years old and Elodie recently turned 16.
Together they have found fame promoting the books they love on TikTok and now they are looking to deepen the connection with fans and broaden their reach.
"We've been building this audience together on TikTok and Instagram for a long time now," said Mireille to Eyewitness News entertainment reporter Sandy Kenyon.
"It's been an amazing experience. All of the offers that we have received have been unimaginable," said Elodie.
The sisters grew up close in Brighton, England.
"When we were little, we were obsessed with the library," said Mireille.
They took to TikTok early, starting "A Life of Literature" and encouraging their peers to read the books they love.
"And, our love of books is behind our new venture, Bindery," added Mireille.
The Lee sisters are part of a diverse group under the Bindery umbrella.
Bindery is the brainchild of Matt Kaye.
"When I saw what was happening with people like Mireille and Elodie on social media, like how many books they were selling and how passionate their audience was, I got really excited about this idea that they could do even more in the publishing world," Kaye said.
His new company is a place to interact directly with fans.
What's even more exciting about the new venture is the opportunity for these influencers to become publishers.
"We get to give unpublished authors a bigger chance to get their books published because they're just as deserving as the other bigger authors in the industry, but they don't necessarily get that chance," said Elodie. "So that's what Bindery is about and that's what everyone's trying to do on the platform."
Once a manuscript is accepted for publication, Bindery acts like a traditional publisher when it comes to editing and cover design and the like, but those who follow Mireille, Elodie and the others get to follow along as that process unfolds.
Readers get to be a part of a book's journey to the point of sale.

title: Trabajadores de fábrica de Boeing inician huelga - Diario Libre
text:
Trabajadores de montaje de aviones abandonaron sus puestos a primera hora del viernes en fábricas de Boeing próximas a Seattle luego de los miembros del sindicado votaron abrumadoramente a favor de la huelga y rechazaron una oferta de contrato que habría elevado sus salarios un 25 % en cuatro años.
La huelga comenzó a las 00:01 de la mañana, menos de tres horas después de que la rama local de la Asociación Internacional de Maquinistas y Trabajadores Aeroespaciales dijo que el 94.6 % de los trabajadores que votaron rechazaron el contrato , y que un 96 % aprobaron la huelga , superando con facilidad el requisito de dos tercios favorables.
El paro afecta a 33,000 maquinistas de Boeing , en su mayoría en el estado de Washington, y se espera que paralice la producción de los aviones comerciales más vendidos del grupo. Aunque no afectará a los vuelos comerciales, supone otro revés para el gigante aeronáutico, cuya reputación y finanzas se han visto golpeadas este años por problemas de facturación y múltiples investigaciones federales.

author: Canadian Press
title: Union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers reaches deal, ends unlimited strike
text:
MONTREAL — A union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers has reached a deal in principle with the government and is ending a strike that has shut around 800 schools since Nov. 23.
Fédération autonome de l’enseignement — or FAE — said Thursday night on social media that it spent the day analyzing a tentative deal with the province and will recommend it to its members for approval during general assemblies after the holidays. Details of the agreement have not been released.
Even though the FAE called the deal "a new step," it emphasized "it is up to the teachers to respond to (Premier) François Legault's government and to say whether they feel they have been heard."
The union said it has ended all of its pressure tactics, such as the general strike that has shut 800 schools, including in Montreal, since the end of November. If students affected by the FAE strike return to school as scheduled in January, they will have been away from classes for almost seven consecutive weeks.
The FAE, which represents more than 66,000 teachers, took the most hard line out of all the public sector unions negotiating new contracts with the government when it launched an unlimited general strike.
Earlier today, the government announced it had reached tentative deals on salaries with an alliance of unions, excluding the FAE, representing 420,000 public sector employees, including teachers and health-care workers. They had walked out sporadically since November, for a total of 11 days.
The only major labour group without any sort of agreement is a nurses union with about 80,000 members — Fédération interprofessionnelle de la santé du Québec — which said today that negotiations are ongoing.
Earlier Thursday, before the FAE announced the end to its strike, Sylvain Martel, spokesman for parents group Regroupement des comités de parents autonomes du Québec, said he was feeling optimistic but remaining cautious that 800 schools would reopen after the holiday break.
"We're glad that we're able to hope for going back to school on Jan. 9, but everything is tentative, lots of people have to agree to what's on the table, so let's hope that it's a real deal and (union) members will get what they want," he said in an interview.
Martel said discussions have been taking place between teachers, parents and administrators about how children will catch up after missing so much school. How that happens will vary, he said, because the effects of the strikes were unequal — some parents taught their children at home, others hired tutors, but many less-fortunate students spent weeks with little to no learning at all.
"It's very difficult for students to go back to the same rhythm they were in November, so it's going to take a little while, but we'll get there," he said.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
The Canadian Press

Cuando parecía que los problemas con José Néstor Pékerman y la Federación Venezolana de Fútbol (FVF) habían terminado, se abre un nuevo capítulo en la polémica. El entrenador argentino, que tuvo un paso memorable por la Selección Colombia, ha denunciado al organismo venezolano por supuestos incumplimientos de su acuerdo de rescisión como entrenador de la Selección de Venezuela.
La llegada de José Néstor Pékerman a la Selección de Venezuela a finales del año 2021 parecía más que prometedora. El entrenador argentino sería el encargado de liderar un proyecto que llevara a La Vinotinto a su primera Copa del Mundo luego del extraordinario trabajo que hizo al mando de la Selección Colombia.
Sin embargo, el ciclo de Pékerman con Venezuela acabó de forma abrupta y conflictiva. A raíz de los problemas entre la Federación Venezolana de Fútbol y el representante del entrenador, Pascual Lezcano. La FVF quiso cortar todo tipo de relación con el agente, pero esto llevó a la salida del seleccionador, quien lo considera una pieza fundamental en su entorno.
Fue en el mes de marzo del año 2023 que se confirmó la salida de Pékerman de La Vinotinto. Las partes habrían llegado a un acuerdo para la rescisión de contrato y la FVF acabó confirmando a Fernando Batista como entrenador de la selección absoluta, luego de su gran trabajo con las subdivisiones del combinado venezolano.
Se reabre el caso Pékerman en Venezuela Según informa Marcelo Bee Sellares, especialista en derecho deportivo y administrativo, José Néstor Pékerman ha iniciado un proceso legal en contra de la FVF por un supuesto incumplimiento del acuerdo de su rescisión. Las partes habrían acordado el pago de su contrato en cuatro plazos (abril, mayo, junio y julio de 2023).

FIFA aceptó el reclamo La FIFA ha emitido un comunicado, en el que confirman que la denuncia por parte de Pékerman ha sido parcialmente aceptada. La FVF está obligada a pagar la suma de 1.710.000 dólares netos en concepto de remuneración adeudada más un 5% de interés y 1.145.700 dólares netos en concepto de penalidad contractual. La federación tiene un plazo de 45 días para abonar la deuda.

title: Fiery TV Debate: French PM Attacks Far-Right Leader on Racism | Politics
text: Fiery TV Debate: French PM Attacks Far-Right Leader on Racism French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal accused Jordan Bardella of the far-right RN party of tolerating racist speech in a heated TV debate before parliamentary elections. The debate also featured socialist leader Olivier Faure, discussing France's future amid rising social tensions. [Reuters](/reuters-stories)| Paris | Updated: 28-06-2024 02:28 IST | Created: 28-06-2024 02:28 IST - Country: - France French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal on Thursday accused his main challenger for the top job, Jordan Bardella, of tolerating racist speech in the ranks of his far-right camp amid a heated last television debate before the start of parliamentary elections. The debate between Attal, National Rally (RN) party chief Bardella and socialist leader Olivier Faure was the last direct confrontation of three radically opposed views on France's future before ballots open for the first voting round on Sunday. "You can't build peace and unity when you present ... more than a hundred candidates who have been accused of making racist remarks", Attal told Bardella, reading out press reports of the politicians using racial slurs. "Each and every one of us must always be uncompromising with hate speech, because if we are not uncompromising, we end up legitimising it," he said. Bardella, whose party is leading in opinion polls and could emerge the dominant political power in the country for the first time, rebuffed the accusations, shouting "This is false!" at his adversary. "I don't like this way of associating a pseudo-climate of hatred with the National Rally electorate", Bardella said later in the debate. Reports of assaults motivated by race, homophobia and political allegiance in the run-up to the election has added to France's already tense social climate less then a month before Paris hosts the world for the Olympics. In an unexpected move earlier this month, President Emmanuel Macron dissolved parliament and called the election after his centrist alliance was crushed in European elections. The outcome will be known after a second round of voting on July 7. Seeking to present his leftwing alliance, the New Popular Front, as an alternative to those opposing Macron's pro-business agenda without shifting to the right, Faure called for a change of wealth distribution. Citing recent protest movements over cost-of-living issues like the "yellow vests" and farmers, as well as anger over a recent raise of the retirement age, Faure said: "It is possible to reject the idea that there are people who through all the crises manage to get richer and richer, while others ... struggle to make ends meet." title: 1000-Lb. Sisters' Amanda Halterman Hospitalized for 3 Days | In Touch Weekly
text:
1000-Lb. Sisters star Amanda Halterman has shared an update on her health, revealing that she was hospitalized for three days after “blacking out.”
“So Sunday afternoon, I had my kids. It was about 5 or 6 o’clock. I had my kiddos over, three of them. I ordered pizza and was trying to clean up and I just blacked out,” the TV personality, 44, explained in an Instagram video on Wednesday, February 19.
She continued, “So, my boyfriend and my children made me come to the hospital, so I’ve been in the hospital for, like, three days now. They’re checking my heart, checking everything, but I feel OK.”
1000-Lb. Sisters' Amanda Details Upbringing: ‘We Grew Up Very Poor’ Amanda added that she was still feeling “under the weather” with congestion, but she wanted to be “transparent” with her fans about what happened to her.
“I want to remind everyone that we should be getting our checkups, regular physicals, regular health checkups, go and get yourself together,” she said. “You know, nobody knows you better than you. So let’s take care of ourselves, OK? Self care is the best kind of care and self-love. So let’s continue to do that.”
Amanda concluded, “You guys say a prayer for your girl and just as soon as I’m able, I’ll see you on [Instagram] Live.”
In the caption, the reality star added, “I am finally home after a three-day stay in the hospital. For now, we wait for a diagnosis and treatment plan.”
Amanda also gave a shoutout to her boyfriend , Leonard Moore .
“Leonard Moore you already know,” she wrote, adding hearts and kissing emojis.
In addition to her health update video, Amanda shared a compilation of photos and clips from her hospital stay. “The first picture I was very disoriented and confused. The second pic was about [four] hours later, the others was the next morning,” she wrote in the caption.
Many fans sent their well wishes in the comments.
“Get better soon!! Prayers being said and big hugs coming your way,” one user wrote, while another fan added, “Praying they find out what’s wrong & get it fixed fast!”
One user praised Amanda’s boyfriend for encouraging her to get checked out.
“Your man is so amazing to get you to go to the hospital. Girl, hold on to him! He’s a keeper,” they wrote.
1000-Lb. Sisters’ Amanda Reveals What Kept Her From Filming TV Series Amanda hard-launched her romance with Leonard , 41, on Instagram in January, sharing a photo of herself and her man posing together in front of a tree.
“Three months together and a lifetime of adventure waits. Here’s to the next road trip love!” she captioned the post.
Amanda has continued to share updates on their romance on her page, including video footage of how the couple celebrated Valentine’s Day.
“Valentine’s Day started with this view on my way to handle some business we always enjoy the views when we are together,” she captioned a road trip video. Another post showed photos and videos taken at a nail salon.
“After business was settled Leonard Moore took me to get a mani pedi and he enjoyed one to! It’s not all about me or all about him it’s about us,” the TLC personality wrote. “Spoiling each other in ways we never knew possible.”

title: Who Is Satish Kumar? Lakshmi Narayan Temple Chief Whose House Was Attacked In Canada | World News, Times Now
text: Who Is Satish Kumar? Lakshmi Narayan Temple Chief Whose House Was Attacked In Canada Satish Kumar is the president of Lakshmi Narayan Mandir, Canada. Satish Kumar is the president of Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey, Canada. On Friday, at least 14 rounds were fired at his son's residence. This is the third time that the Lakshmi Narayan temple or its members have come under attack from Khalistan supporters. Satish Kumar is the president of Lakshmi Narayan Mandir, Surrey. The attack is seen as a revenge attack over a protest held by the temple against Khalistani Extremist extremists. The counter-protest was organised against Khalistani extremists at this temple last month when they gathered to attack the temple premises. Speaking exclusively to Times Now, Satish Kumar said that the incident happened at his son's house and added that the police are investigating the matter at the moment. When asked about the possible suspect behind the attack, he said that he could not say anything at the moment. Speaking on the connection between this attack and the attack that took place on the temple, he said that it is not related and it could have been extortion. In August, the well-known Hindu temple in Canada’s British Columbia was vandalised with anti-India graffiti, drawing massive outrage within the Indian community. Khalistan referendum posters were also pasted on the main door of the temple at midnight, according to reports. title: The 10 best scenic winter train rides in North America
text: Winter landscapes can be truly gorgeous, especially when snow is cascading down and the icy ground shimmers in the light. But let’s be honest, it’s a lot easier to enjoy these scenic landscapes when you’re not driving through treacherous road conditions. If you’d like to take in some snowy grandeur while remaining safe and warm, a winter train ride is the perfect solution. And if you need to travel during the winter — and have some extra time to do it at a more leisurely pace — one of these train rides could upgrade the experience to an exciting adventure. Amtrak Vermonter (between Washington, D.C. and St. Albans, Vermont) If, like Robert Frost, you like the idea of “stopping by woods on a snowy eventing,” then take a ride on the Vermonter. It departs from Union Station in Washington, D.C., then passes through nine states on its way to St. Albans, Vermont near the shore of Lake Champlain. The entire journey, which takes about 13 hours, will take you through both big cities and small New England towns. Take the trip during a snowy month and you’ll see a glistening white wooded landscape as you pass through cozy Vermont hamlets like Brattleboro, Bellows Falls, Waterbury and Essex. It also stops near Camel’s Hump State Park in Montpelier, a majestic place for hiking. You can [book your trip on Amtrak](https://www.amtrak.com/vermonter-train). MORE: [This train ride stops in 37 cities on the way from New York to New Orleans](https://www.simplemost.com/train-ride-stops-37-cities-way-new-york-new-orleans/) Amtrak Coast Starlight (between Los Angeles and Seattle) The Coast Starlight, which runs between Los Angeles and Seattle, is known for its observation cars (aka sightseer lounges), which provide gorgeous views through floor-to-ceiling windows. In other words, this is a train designed for sitting back and taking in the cinematic landscape. Anyone with a ticket has access to these cars, which are especially coveted as the train passes the town of Oxnard and hugs the coast for the next three hours. For the best views, try to get a seat on the left side of the train. The scenery in Oregon will also knock you out, as you wind through glistening forests, white-capped mountains and numerous lakes. The train leaves L.A. every day at 10 a.m. and arrives in Seattle 34 hours later, getting in at around 8 p.m. the next day. [Book tickets here](https://www.amtrak.com/coast-starlight-train). Amtrak California Zephyr (between Chicago and San Francisco) The California Zephyr passes through seven states on its daily, 2,437-mile journey from Chicago to the San Francisco Bay Area. You can ride the train for just one portion of the trip or stick around for all 51 hours and 20 minutes. While the Zephyr will take you through some major cities (Omaha, Denver, Salt Lake City) and smaller ones (Naperville, Illinois, Lincoln, Nebraska, Glenwood Springs, Colorado), the main attraction here is the mountains. You’ll pass through both the Rocky Mountains and the Sierra Nevadas, with stunning, wintry views you wouldn’t get if traveling by car. There’s also a cool, historical aspect to this train ride: You’ll pass over a stretch of hand-built railroad in the Sierras that was built during the Civil War as part of the transcontinental railroad route. [Book tickets here](https://www.amtrak.com/california-zephyr-train). White Pass and Yukon Route Railway (between Skagway, Alaska, Fraser, British Columbia, Carcross, Yukon and Whitehorse, Yukon) Would you like a side dish of history as you gobble up spectacular views? Then head to the Alaskan seaport town of Skagway, and take one of the excursions on the White Pass & Yukon Route Railroad. (The White Pass Summit Excursion is the most popular. The 40-mile trip takes about three hours.) This historic railroad, which was built in the late 1800s during the Gold Rush, features vintage parlor cars. One of them (the car named Lake LeBerge) carried Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip to Whitehorse during their tour of Canada and the United States in 1959. Of course, the main attraction is the stunning views as the train climbs 3,000 feet past gorges, waterfalls and glacial rivers. For the best views on the way up, sit on the left side of the car. [Book tickets here](https://wpyr.com/).
